payload.name: rhetorical
payload.core: Reasoning aimed at belief-change and coordination, considering audience, framing, and the classical triad of ethos (credibility), pathos (emotion), and logos (logic). Prioritizes adoption over pure truth-preservation.

out.d: strategic placement of ideas relative to alternatives

proc: analyze audience: identify values, concerns, prior beliefs
select framing: choose perspective that resonates with audience
balance appeals: weigh ethos, pathos, logos for context
construct narrative: build coherent story around key claims
anticipate objections: prepare responses to likely resistance
validate alignment: ensure message serves legitimate goals

diff.theory-of-mind: applies audience model vs builds mental model
diff.narrative: uses story for persuasion vs story for understanding

ex.sit: Engineering team must convince leadership to invest in technical debt reduction. Leadership values speed and features.
steps: audience: executives value ROI, speed, competitive advantage
framing: debt as velocity tax, not cleanup
ethos: cite past delivery success and credibility
logos: show metrics on defect rates and slowdown
pathos: paint vision of faster future releases
narrative: investment now enables Q3 feature acceleration
ex.insight: reframing technical debt as velocity enablement aligns engineering needs with leadership values
